text: This is a list of fictional doctors (characters that use the appellation "doctor", medical and otherwise), from literature, films, television, and other media. Shakespeare created a doctor in his play Macbeth (c 1603)The doctor in history, literature, folk-lore, etc edited by William Andrews p.9 with a "great many good doctors" having appeared in literature by the 1890s and, in the early 1900s, the "rage for novel characters" included a number of "lady doctors".Doctor and patient By Silas Weir Mitchell p.81 Solomon Posen had collected a list of books with "a doctors as a principal figure" which he says resulted in a list of over 10,000 works as of 2005.Doctors in fiction: lessons from literature By Borys Surawicz, Beverly Jacobson Early cinematic and television representations of doctors typically characterized the practice of medicine as being "in safe (male) hands,"Frames and fictions on television: the politics of identity within drama By Bruce Carson, Margaret Llewellyn- Jones p. 51 with 90% of doctors on television through 1989 being male.The psychology of television John C.
